11513222221132221.content:
On a sweltering savanna day, a young lion cub lied down beneath a shady bushy tree of a nearby waterfall/watering hole, a jungle like area a bit ways between Pride Rock and the Outlands. And the heat wave was the only threat that pervaded the Pridelands at the moment. Nothing the Lion Guard could do. In fact, the rest of the guard were off cooling down with their families and friends.

While the lion's den back at Pride Rock was cool and shady enough, Kion thought this little jungle like paradise was just as good and next to a water source to drink and swim in.

"YAWN!"

However, his body was yearning for some rest and long nap as his eyelids felt heavy. Soon, he fell into a deep slumber.

It wasn't until around ten minutes later that something unusual happened. His body glowed in a golden light and he began to shrink! Soon, he was the size of a grub with the world becoming much larger as blades of grass became as tall as trees. After a while, Kion tossed a bit before waking up, stretching and yawning as he got up. He slowly opened his eyes to discover his surroundings had drastically changed.

"What happened to me?!" he said looking around in panic of the bigger world he was in. Then, he heard a familiar voice as it flew pass him.

"I'm late! I'm late! I'm terribly terribly late!"

"Zazu?!"

It was the red billed hornbill yet as small as he was and didn't seem to notice or care about. He kept repeating about being late but for what?

"Hey, wait up!"

Kion called out as he attempt to catch up with the bird before he dove into a meerkat hole at the base of a nearby tree. The lion cub followed suit into the hole before tumbling down into it. After getting up and shaking off some dirt, he found himself at the beginning of a tunnel. Zazu seemed to have went farther ahead into as he couldn't see him anymore down the passage yet could still hear his mantra of being late. After going down some ways, he encountered a three way fork in the road and decided which path to take.

Which way did he go?
11513222221132221.title: Through the Meerkat Hole

choices: His neck grows longer that a giraffe's and gets flexible as a snake!
Kion suddenly transforms into an anthropomorphic lion!
115132222211322211.content:
After choosing the path to the left Kion walked for a good long while. He had just started to wonder how long this tunnel could be, when he turned a corner and spotted the exit to the cave up ahead.

"Finally, a way out," said Kion. He hurried to the exit, but stopped abruptly when he saw what was outside.

Whereever he was, it certainly wasn't the Pride Lands. Although it was a forest of some kind, it was much too dense to be anywhere near the savannah.
Kion didn't recognize any of the plant-life either. Some of the foliage had shapes that could only be decribed as 'bizarre' and Kion was certain that some of the flowerstalks were actually turning towards him, as if they were looking at him!

"What.....is this place?" wondered Kion as he looked around.

As much as he wanted to know where he was, he was more concerned with what Zazu was doing here in the first place. But before he could look for Zazu, he needed something to drink; the long trip through the cave had made him rather thirsty.

Spotting a pond nearby, Kion walked over and eagerly drank some of the water. But, as soon as he'd finished drinking, Kion started to feel very strange.

"What's....happening....to me?" he grunted as the uncomfortable feeling intensified.

So, what happened to Kion?
115132222211322211.title: A Strange Forest...

choices: Kion comes across a strange house
Kion hears someone talk to him
1151322222113222111.content:
Kion moaned as the weird feeling began to center itself in his neck, of all places.

"Wh-what's...going...on?" uttered Kion with difficulty, due to the feeling in his neck.
He didn't get much time to think about it further, because the strange feeling suddenly got so strong that he was forced to close his eyes. The feeling itself also changed; instead of a tingling, it felt more like a 'stretching', however odd that sounded.

It was only when the strange feeling had finally disappeared that Kion opened his eyes again. The first thing he noticed was that his line of sight was now equal with the tops of the foreign trees nearby.

"Huh? How did those trees shrink?" he said. It took a moment before he realized that the trees were still the size they were before.
Kion's expression turned from confusion to horrified as he remembered the stretching feeling in his neck and the connection to his new line of sight. He took a deep breath, looked down....and let out a scream of shock.

His neck had grown! Massively so! It was longer than the neck of any giraffe! Far below him, he could still see his body with his very long neck attatched to it, though it looked tiny from so high up.

Naturally, he freaked out.

"Waaah!" he yelled. "My neck! How did it get so long?! What's happening?!?"

Kion could not help but make a jump of fright at what happened to him, but that turned out to be a bad idea.

"WOAH!" screamed Kion, as his neck swung around in a great circle. The vibrations from his little jump had travelled up his neck and had been amplified because of its new length, causing it to swing around rapidly.

Fortunately for Kion, it didn't last very long.

"Ooohhhh.....Dizzy," he slurred, as his neck stopped swaying. Not wanting to risk another incident like that by trying to shake his head, Kion decided to close his eyes tightly for a moment, until the dizzyness had faded.

When he opened his eyes again, he very carefully took another look down.

"Hevi kabisa," said Kion. "This is really freaky. My neck has to be taller than three giraffes standing on each others heads." He looked a little closer. "The rest of my body didn't change at all; but it looks so weird seeing it from all the way up here."

Kion sighed. "If only I knew how this happened, then may I could reverse it somehow..." That was when a thought hit him.

"Wait... That watering hole! It must have been the water that did this to me!" he realized. "Maybe if I drink from it again, perhaps it can change me back to normal!"

He turned his body towards the watering hole again, but since he had forgotten his current situation in his eagerness to return to normal, the motion of his body caused his long neck and his head to hit several branches on a tree he had been standing right next to.

"Ouch!" he groaned. It was rather painful to have something impact ones neck and with the extra long neck that Kion now had, it was even more so.

"Ugh!" groaned Kion. "That really hurt. I have to remember to be more careful with this long neck, until I can return to normal."

He tried to pull away from the tree, but found that he couldn't.

"Hey; why am I stuck?" he said. He looked down to see what the problem was. He gasped in surprise when he saw that his neck had wrapped itself around several branches during the impact.

"Okay, this is almost weirder than before," admitted Kion. "It's almost like my neck not only got longer, but also more dexterious; as if it was a snake."

Indeed; Kion's neck was currently wrapped around the branches of the tree in such a way, that if it hadn't been his own neck, he could have mistaken it for a massive snake.

Kion frowned. 'Oh, great,' he thought, 'How am I supposed to get out of this mess? If only I had more control over my neck...' Kion's eyes widened as he realized how dumb he had been.

"Of course," he almost yelled. "I thought that my new neck was as stiff as a giraffes, but if it is capable of wrapping around a tree like this, then it HAS to be as flexible as a snake is! I just have to get used to the new flexibility and then I can untangle myself!"

Focusing on his neck, Kion tried to slowly move the part that wasn't stuck around like he had seen snakes move. It turned out to be more difficult than he thought.

"This is really hard," said Kion as he carefully tried to move only a part of his neck, without success. "I should be able to do it since my neck is wrapped around the tree. So why...?"

Kion did a sharp intake of air as he understood. "That's it!" he said. "All this time I've subconciously been thinking of my neck like it normally is, which is why I haven't made any progress! I need to think of it as it currently is; as flexible as... Well, I don't know how it feels for a snake to move, but I do know how my tail feels when I move it! Perhaps I should start by imagining that my neck is just a very long tail that's attached to my front. There's certainly no harm in trying."

Kion closed his eyes and began to focus only on the feeling of his neck and tail. He lifted his tail up and then tried to copy the same kind of movement with the part of his neck that was still free.

"Come on!", growled Kion in concentration. Then, it happened. He could feel the part of his neck that was free lifting up slowly, freeing a little more of it.

"It worked!" exclaimed Kion as he opened his eyes again to see the top part of his neck untangle itself from the two branches it had been stuck between.

"It feels weird, though," observed Kion. "It's like I have a very long, extra flexible limb that I can move in all manner of ways." As a sort of experiment, Kion moved the free part of his neck so that it first formed a shape like the letter 'c' and then one like the letter 's'.

"It must feel weird to be a snake," said Kion. "I can't imagine what it would be like to have your whole body to be like this."

He snapped out of his thoughts rather quickly when he realized that he had been close to forgetting that he was still tangled in the tree.

"That's right; I need to focus on getting out of this mess," he said.

Slowly and very carefully, Kion began to untangle his neck from the tree. It wasn't without its challenges, though. In some places his neck had wrapped itself around a branch several times, while in others it resembled golden-brown vines hanging over them. In one place, his neck had actually come very close to tying itself into a knot, something that Kion was very glad didn't happen.

Eventually, Kion managed to completely unwrap his neck from the tree.

"There! That's better!" he said. He moved his neck so that his head was in such a position, so he could get an even better look at it.

"Huh," he said. "Apart from being very long, there's not that much difference between my old neck and my new one." He looked up and down his hyper-flexible neck, and smiled."But with this neck, I can have a lot more fun."

Kion then used his newly learned fine control over his long neck to form complex figures with it; at one point even creating a silluette of Pride Rock.

He then got the idea to use his neck to look at himself from completely new angles. For example; he had never seen his own back from a birds-eye perspective before, but now he could do it! Kion amused himself with watching his body from all new perspectives; even looking at his own tail and backside from the perspective of someone standing behind him.

"You know; having a long neck might not be so bad," chuckled Kion, before he got serious again. "But it has to go. If any of my friends find me, they would freak out at this. That, and I still have to find Zazu."

Kion turned his head towards he watering hole, only to find that, for some inexplicable reason, it had vanished!

"Oh, no!" exclaimed Kion, before he frantically used his neck to search every angle of the surrounding area. "This is not good! If the water is gone, then I can't return to normal!"

Unfortunately, Kion's search proved fruitless. He was actually starting to worry again; it had been a lot funnier examining himself with his neck, when he thought that he could easily return back to normal afterwards.

"Great! Now what do I do?" sighed Kion as he looked sadly as his freakishly elongated neck. "I can't walk around with such a long neck. Even though I have gotten control over it, it's still too long for me to completely avoid wrapping itself around other obstacles." Kion sighed again. "But, I can't just stay here either. I have to explore this place if I want to find a way to reverse this. So, I have to find a solution."

Kion thought for a while before he got a somewhat good idea. Very carefully, Kion reduced the length of his neck by first wrapping it around his stomach and chest, and then coiling more of it in a circle on his back.

Of course, this resulted in Kion's neck laying on top of the part that he had wrapped around his body, which was a really weird feeling, but it was tolerable for Kion, even though it also felt a bit heavy.

The end result was that Kion's neck was now a lot more manageable for him, since the remaining part of his neck was now only as long as a gazelle was tall.

Now prepared to explore, Kion walked further into the forest, carefully avoiding anything on the ground that could scrape against his neck.

What happens next?
1151322222113222111.title: Long Neck; Lots of Problems

1151322222113222112.content:
"What's...happening? Ugh!" he groaned as he felt his fore paws cracked as they began to change.

The digits stretched and lengthened with sharp claws/fingernails, becoming more humanoid. His forelegs changed into arm like limbs, lengthening too to fit his new developing frame. Reminding him a bit of Rafiki.

"Whoa!" he said as he fell backwards in shock onto his back, seeing more changes to his lower half.

His hind paws, like with his fore ones, cracked and stretched into foreign human like feet with five toes on each with black nails. He wriggled them in disbelief and awe to make sure that they were real and his. Like his arms, his legs lengthened to fit his new frame.

"UGH!" he cried out as he felt a pelvis forming in his midsection with a waist and hips. He grunted as he developed a human like torso with a chest cavity and his shoulders widened further apart to accommodate.

He panted as he lied down onto the grass with his newly formed limbs spread as his transformation seemed to be over.

Did he stopped transforming?

115132222211322212.content:
Kion just went down the middle path, not wanting to wait any longer so he can catch up to Zazu. After some time, the pathway began to shrink as the corridor became cramped with his mane nearly scrapping the ceiling. How darker it was complicated things further.

'Maybe I should head back and take a different way.' he thought to himself. However, before he could turn around, his next step made him tumble onto a slide.

"WHOA!" he cried as he rode down with twists and turns around every corner. The ride took a few minutes before it dropped him into a room.

"OOF!"

He landed onto his back after falling a couple feet off the ground. Kion got up and shook off some dirt before taking a look at his surroundings. The room was rather large, like the size of a fully grown tree, made up of clay colored rock like the lion's den but unnaturally near smooth and perfectly square. The floor was a gray slate, also smoothed out. The walls were adorned with some cave drawings of various animals, similar to the ones Rafiki makes.

But what caught his attention was a smooth flat round rock in the center of the room as tall as he was. On top were two half coconuts, like it was perfectly cut down the middle. As he approached them out of curiosity, he discovered the halves were filled with some kind of liquid, the left blue while the right red. His nose caught a fruity scent from them. What would they taste like?

"I'm late! I'm terribly terribly late!"

A familiar voice broke him out of his thoughts as Zazu flew past him, now the size of a beetle, smaller than before. Now where did he come from?

"Huh? Wait!" Kion called as he tried to pounce at him only to miss as the bird flew into a door the size of a mouse hole. A feint click was heard afterward, locked.

'Now what?' he thought to himself as he looked around the room, looking for a way out.

He then looked back to the coconuts again. He was getting a bit thirsty and maybe a drink might help.

Which coconut did he drink from?
115132222211322212.title: Middle Path

1151322222113222121.content:
Approaching the filled coconuts, he looked towards the one with the blue liquid. Sweet scent of berries filled his nostrils. He lapped at it once for a taste, then his eyes lit up on how tasty it was. Soon, he guzzled it down in a flash.

"Aaah." he sighed, wiping his mouth his paw.

Nothing seemed to happen at first, but soon he found his surroundings becoming larger as he shrunk down to Zazu's size from earlier. Now he would be able to fit through the door! He ran towards it and with his front paws he tried to push the door open.

"Ugh! Come on! Open!" he cried out as the door didn't budge no matter how much force he used, even trying to use his head and zebra kicked it. He noticed the handle and yanked it with his teeth yet still to no avail. The keyhole just below it stared at him and he stared back.

'Maybe something had to fit in there to open it?' he thought to himself. Looking around the gargantuan room, he spotted the black crude looking key, halfway over the ledge of the stone table. When did he missed that when he drank from the coconut? Still, how was he going to get it with his size dilemma? Just one obstacle after another.

While looking around for another solution, he discovered something at the corner of his right eye. East of him was some kind of crude treasure box/chest, reddish brown with gold outlines. Again, things felt like they were popping right out of nowhere and just confusing him even more so.

He approached the chest and with a paw flipped the lid right open to see that the chest was full of...
1151322222113222121.title: One with Blue liquid

11513222221132221212.content:
Flipping the lid open revealed a whole load of chocolate chip cookies. Of course, Kion didn't know what these light brown discs with bits of black embedded into them, but they did smell really sweet. Odd that the chocolate chips on each cookie seemed to spell out some kind of message.

"Eat...me?" he repeated the cookie saying.

'Guess it is good and safe to eat.' he thought. He leaned in and picked up a cookie with his mouth, biting into it.

"Mmmmm!"

Very good and very chewy delicious! He went through half the chest of cookies like how Pumbaa scarfs down a bug buffet.

"Burrrrp!" Kion belched loudly.

He lied down onto his back to rest, patting his stuffed belly. However, a strange tingling sensation coursed throughout his body that became warmer.

What happens next?
11513222221132221212.title: C is for...

115132222211322212121.content:
The warmth spread throughout his body that gradually became intenser, causing him to squirm on the spot.

"Ugh, maybe I shouldn't have eaten too mu--WHOA!"

Kion was interrupted as he felt his body begin to expand and grow, his surroundings starting to shrink. Soon, the room became slightly cramped as he filled it, stopping just before his head hit the ceiling. He saw the key and grabbed it. Now he had his means to escape but another problem was apparent.

"Great! I'm too big to fit through!" he exclaimed in defeat. "Now what to do?"
